Connecting to the chargers is quick and easy with no worries about crocodile clips springing off in the middle of the night.  The connector is protected from dampness by a small plastic cover.  Worth the investment.

It locks and unlocks well with a "positive" engagement feel when it is secure. Fits great for both my front bumper receiver and rear receiver on my 2005 Dodge Ram.  No complaints, and I'd definitely buy it again.

I tried these wipers recently and can say that they do a good job. They get a solid 3 star rating.The wipers do in fact clean your windshield and do a good job and removing water, debris, etc that is on your windshield. The wipers do install pretty easy. What these wipers don't do is impress me. The price point is good, at $13 a piece you are looking at a cost of around $26 to get wipers for your car. Not bad.But I also have tried a number of Bosch blades and prefer theBosch 4841 Evolution All-Season Bracketless Wiper Blade, 22" (Pack of 1)to these. Those don't totally impress me either, but I notice that they do a better job at removing more water and being streak free. For example, if you drive through a car wash and at the exit flip on your wipers to shake off the last bit of water both blades will in fact clean the water off. But I found the Anco left some small streaks and drops of water behind where the Bosch left a nearly dry surface.You really can't go wrong with these wipers, is it worth an extra dollar to go with Bosch? Probably not. In the rain a little tiny streak won't be evident, in sunny weather that excess water will evaporate quickly, it's really a tiny amount. If you need wipers get these and try them out, they do in fact work, I'm just not giving it more then 3 stars because I am not "wowed" by these.

In order to replace the oxygen sensor, I needed a way to tighten in the new unit. While this could also be used to remove the old one, the slot in the side weakens the structure which could result in breakage. To avoid that risk, just cut the top half off the old one and back it out with an air wrench and impact socket. Then this socket installs the new one without damage.

We've set this up 3 times since we left on our trip April 27th. Today, the 3rd time hooking it up, the elbow completely separated from the hose. Now with about 1/2 roll of duct tape holding it on it's still dripping. Flimsy, there are others out there worth the $$$ This isn't!
Does a fine job. Only had to do it once last season.  We'll see how it works on a full season

This is a must if you use the Moroso tire gauge. I do not know why it is sold separately. It should come pre fitted to the gauge. I'm sure no one will complain given the fact that it protects the gauge against knocks, even if it added a few bucks to the gauge, which is not cheap in the first place.

Must have!! Don't waste your money on those cheap pre-set regulators ( most are NOT lead free - how do they get away w/ that?????) This is easy to attach and use and the water pressure makes for a wonderful shower and cleaning your toilet (just sayin) while protecting your RV pipes.
These are very flimsy but work, just be very careful how tight you try to make the nut that secures the nozzle to the hood.

I will come right out of the gate and explain that I found the constant application and re-applications and buffing to be tedious, time consuming and annoying.  If you enjoy working on your car and have time to kill then this may be worthwhile time spent but if you are like my husband and myself then it leaves a lot to be desired when it comes to the wasted time.The glass sealant works but you have to make sure that your windows are crystal clean or there will be a haze.  We have had a few storms, hot days and pigeon attacks.  The windows seem less dusty but the pigeon fecal matter now slides down rather than stay put.  The windshield wipers do effortlessly glide, which I personally love.  My only grip would be that this product seems to do exactly what our old RainX does!  Seriously, there isn't much difference except for the fecal running.  I am not sure what would motivate me to reach for this product over the RainX considering how annoying the application was.  Maybe better results are yielded if used in conjunction with other Griot's Garage products?Recommend if you are in the market for a great glass cleaner that allows your windshield wipers to work effortlessly.  The rain just glides off and there is a longer period of dustless windows.  I cannot with good conscience though, suggest that this product is any different than it's competitor.
My only complaint would be that the leads (wires) are pretty short, although I understand the reasons for making them that way.Appears to be sufficiently accurate and is very easy to use.

I have always found Meguiar's products to be among the best so I was happy to test this new product.  I used this on a 1997 Accord that had oxidized headlights. Results were good but the kit should include one more sandpaper sheet.  The kit includes a protectant to apply to the newly cleaned headlights.  I used a 3m kit in the past (on a different car) which did not include a protectant and the headlights discolored again in about 6 months.  Time will tell if Meguiar's protectant keeps the headlights from oxidizing again.  Overall, this kit is fairly easy to use but I preferred using a drill with a cleaning solution (as the 3m kit had) to using sandpaper and sanding by hand. That's just my personal preference but some will prefer the convenience of this kit.

These great little towels have ended up everywhere.  A couple in the garage, a few at the office, a couple in every room of the house.  They're great for just about everything.  Having been ripped off in the sham-wow scam, these seem even better.  They're soft and useful, wash up well, and come in a great quantity.

I was looking for a micro fiber towel for use with quick detail sprays and decided to try these. I am not that impressed with them. Even though they are thick and soft they seem to leave the fine micro fiber hairs on the car like lint. I now use them for washing the vehicle and seem to work fine for that.

Wish they would have made this thing a little smaller - or a design that works with most buckets. Had to cram it down my Lowes bucket which is punching out the sides. I have to fill my 5gal bucket up 8" now because the grate doesn't come close to the bottom. I guess it still works, but I wouldn't buy it again.
This is by far the best brake controller I have ever used in 30 years of towing. Has a wide range of tow setting to accommodate different trailer weights. I wouldn't use anything else!

Since I had just noticed my wiper blades needed replacing, I was pleased to see this item on the Vine newsletter and promptly ordered. The compatibility check is very convenient and tells you instantly which size to order for your car. Delivery was prompt, but the cardboard box was huge. Twice the length of the blade. Then the real surprise - there was only one blade! When you order one - you get one blade, not one set.I looked at the blade carefully, trying to decide if I wanted to order another one since the price per blade is more than most. The rubber blade is certainly much thicker and seems more sturdy that any I've ever had before, so I ordered another one and waited for it to be delivered.It arrived promptly, too, and installation turned out to be very, very easy, since my car has the bayonet type fitting, which the blade arrives with. The frameless style is quite nice. BUT, if you have a different type of fitting, the back of the package instructs you to refer to the instructions and additional adapters inside the box. Well, neither of mine came with any instructions or adapters in the box. Lucky for me that my car uses the the adapter that comes installed in the blade and I have installed wipers before. Other reviewers seem to have had the same experience.The blades fit well and seem to work well. I would actually say they are of exceptional quality. But selling them individually at a premium price and neglecting to include instructions or adapters as advertised is an issue for me. Even though the blades are very nice, I'm not sure I would buy these again because of these issues. Hopefully the manufacturer will read these reviews and take action to make sure the instructions and adapters end up in the box.As a side note, because it isn't specified on the packaging, I Googled for the Autotex PINK website and found that 10% of every purchase, year round, is donated to the National Breast Cancer Foundation. I'm impressed.
I use it to charge my scooter and it works great. Very easy to use. I would recommend this product.

I'm using this to keep the battery charged up in a car parked outside and covered in long-term storage.  I don't have to worry about humidity or moisture causing it any problems.  I've owned many Battery Tender products and this one, like them all, are high quality and work perfectly.

These are matched well for tire and wheel cleaning. I also used the long brush with soft bristles to scrub the plastic splash guards on each end of the car and the wheel splash guards. Saves getting my wash mitt as dirty .  Bristles are long enough they worked very good on the rims, plus the short brush has stiff bristles for the sidewalls. Good buy.

I'm replacing the chrome accents on my 2011 Sahara Tan JKU with black ones. This was a very easy upgrade. I sat my Jeep in the sun for a couple of hours, went out and the old logo just pulled right off after cutting behind them with some fishing line. Then you're left with some sticky residue which comes off very easily with liquid glue remover and elbow grease. I actually marked just above the tops of the old letters with black perm. marker before removing them. Then you just pull the backing paper off of the new logo and apply - moving the logo up 1/8 inch to just cover your marker marks. There is also a film attached to the front of the letters so they all go on at once, you don't have to apply each letter individually. This took about 30 minutes total to remove the old logo and apply the new one. It's been a month and it still looks awesome - no fading so far.

This is a good quality, soft mitt. The only reason I took one star off is because it is somewhat thinner than the one it replaced. I just wish I could remember where I bought the original, and what brand it was (all the old labels faded to white).This one is a good value for the money...
After 3 oil changes, things are looks MUCH cleaner with this oil. I am sticking with it for a good while over more spendy ones.
Great product, looks good on my new 2012 Jeep Wrangler! Easy to install, just takes a little while, don't rush!

This is the 3 brake one way value bleeder. I used 2 for many years to bleed one wheel set at a time. The old version could be taken apart for cleaning as flushing old brake fluid can cause the one way value to leak. The new model seems to be pressed together so not sure if you can clean the unit if debris stops the value from seating.Product and motion pro package-instructions looks high quality. The Aluminum main body also has an arrow stamped into the body to ensure you install it correctly. (old versions did not.Many of the motorcycle news groups recommend this product as do I. Just be careful to keep the brake fluid away from your face/eyes.

I was just reading a High end European car forum. Discussed was how you have to use Meguires or Mothers Gold,clay, etc. Many were insisting that you had to spend some big money and get it right. That couldn't be further from the truth. Nu-Finish works and really will protect your paint and is a fraction of cost of other designer waxes. Nu-Finish IS NOT A WAX, it's a POLISH. Why wax a clear coat anyway? Waxing a clearcoat is dumber than a bag of hammers.Nu-Finish will not harm a clearcoat,absolutely will not. It shines as good as any car wax and lasts a long,long time. This stuff works. If it didn't it would not have lasted so long. Look at the high ratings. Screw those expensive designer waxes that last about a week, get some Nu-Finish, the professional detailers secret!
Wanted these to go in my f150 third brake light cargo bulbs.  They are brighter than the stock 921s and the color is much more usable.

This is hands down the best car wax for the money. The trick is applying it VERY thinly in the shade, after shaking the bottle a lot. A little of this wax goes a long, long way. I usually allow at least 30 minutes for the wax to haze before buffing it off.
The best towels I have used. Amazing for drying my cars. Can not beat the price either. Highly recommend these towels.

I have replaced nearly every accessory light on every vehicle I own, including my RV trailer.  They're most efficient at saving power, so I replaced every bulb on my trailer with these.  I had extras left over, and began to replace all the similar bulbs with these LED type.  Since they save volts, you can extrapolate that they'll cause your alternator less strain to keep you 12 volt system topped up.  That means better fuel economy.  I'm not sure that the amount of fuel that is saved can be easily measured, but it has to be something.  Additionally, these things last nearly forever, so when you replace that burned out bulb, that will be the last time you'll have to do it.
Even in NJ weather that can be sleet, snow or rain at any time, these perform and are quiet. Now my friends want me to order them for their cars.

I can confirm this oil filter fits the 2013 Sears/Craftsman GT6000 garden tractor.  The price was right., quite a bit better than the OEM Kohler junk filter Sears sells.  Walmart carries a Purolator L10241 for a buck less, but it's not the same quality/rating as this Purolator PL10241, 99.9% PureOne filter.

Great budget-friendly item to add to the garage arsenal. Microfiber wrapped around medium foam. Works great for sealants and wax application. I used them with liquid wax, and I love that they don't absorb 50% of what you're trying to apply to a surface - like standard foam pads do. You want a bit on the applicator, but enough to prime it so it spreads easier.If you use liquid products with these, be sure to give them a good pre-soak in hot water and microfiber detergent to break down the wax/sealant. I also like to wash these separately from microfiber towels - especially the ones you dry or clean windows with. These will hold a lot of product which can and most likely will, spread to the rest of everything in the wash.I use a little bit more microfiber detergent in a small (hot water) load, let it wash half way through the cycle, then stop it so it can soak for 10-15 minutes, and then let it finish on it's own. If you use a dryer, make sure you do it on low heat.AND ABSOLUTELY NO FABRIC SOFTENERS, that includes dryer sheets. Stay awayyy!
Added this to my Honda CT90 Trail bike's handle bars.  Now everyone calls it my 'purse'.  Looks pretty gay and will go with a pink helmet....
Cheaper than the dealer, and easy to install, if you read your owner's manual. Fit like the original and saved me $$.
I've tried a lot of microfiber towels over the years and these are the best yet. They absorb water very good and will last a long time. Recommend for detailer and enthusiasts.

Because of the limited area this item works in, it's best suited for small containers. I put this in the tackle box and it works great. When it's not fishing season, hooks and leaders sit for months at a time going unused and this little thing is the perfect thing to help prevent rust. It's not powerful enough to put in a gun safe or anything like that. Just suitable for smaller containers like small tool boxes or tackle boxes. However, the cost of buying these and keeping them in a tackle box year round to prevent rust on hooks and leaders may not be cost effective, since hooks and leaders are cheap. However, if you have fishing lures your looking to keep in good condition, then this would be the right item for you.

I wasn't looking for a shine that looks like I slicked oil on my tires, just something to make them look "new". This product did that.  My car is garage kept so I can't attest to the protection that it gives but it did clean the tires and make them look really nice.
This brush is fantastic. It's not really stiff, so you don't have to worry about scratching your rims. Yet, it's durable enough to get a lot of the dirt/grime.

So far this battery charger is working very well have the unit about 6 months for a battery for a riding mower. I have been buying a battery every year so I thought I would try one of these units to see if it would make the battery last longer. I always took the battery out of the mower in the winter and placed it in the basement and had to charge it in the spring, but it's seamed that the battery would not last all year or the season anyway. I will find out this spring if it does work.
I needed more lighting in my new trailer and this unit did the trick. Very reasonably priced but works every bit as well as the overpriced models at typically camping supply stores. I recommend it.
got it quick, works great love it ,easy to read nice and small easy to carry and easy to store.

Check engine light came on wife's car. Took it to a local mechanic and had it diagnosed and repaired for under $200. He did nothing other than clear the code and told the wife to tighten the gas cap on her next fill up. Within a few days the check engine light came back on again, so the money paid to the mechanic was for nothing. Surfing the web sites I found others had problems and spend much money on their mechanics who were incompetent in resolving OBD2 error messages.At this point I decided to fix it myself and purchased the Innova 3100. I know nothing about error codes but with the help from Innova technical support, the internet newsgroup, various repair websites, the Haynes repair manual and youtube, I was able to fix the problem. I was also able to pinpoint and fix the problem on my son's car as well when his check engine light came on. How cool is this?Wow, the 3100 is a very nice unit, money this time very well spend. Couldn't do without it now. I must also add the Innova tech was extremely helpful, welling to spend as much time as needed on the phone to resolve any questions I had and going through troubleshooting procedures with me as well. BTW, you get a real knowledgeable English-speaking technician from Innova, not someone from India with a heavy English accent.
Fast & easy to install and worked perfect when connected to my Tekonsha P3!! So glad I went ahead and purchased this!!

I connected one end to my motorcycle battery and the other end to a Female Cigarette Adapter (http://amzn.com/B0041CDPQO) and now it is so easy to charge my cellphone or use the air pump. Very handy and convenient.

Got ready to dump the dreaded "Black Tank" and when I removed the cap I got my hand soaked with black water.  After completely dumping the tank I ordered a replacement.  Got to the house in just a few days.  It was a perfect fit and took about 10 minutes to swamp out.  Happy camper here.
It appears to be well made.  I needed it to secure a band on  cvc boot…works great.  The tool for the job!!

This specific 18 inch wiper blade went on our 2003 Toyota Matrix, passenger side.This wiper does not come with any adapters. It is specifically for cars with "u" type hook connections. Though you might be able to fudge on size a little (I used the 22 inchBosch 22A ICON Wiper Bladeon my driver's side which recommended a 21 inch blade with no problems) but you cannot fudge on connectors. Please make sure that this specific wiper blade is certified for your vehicle.The most difficulty I had was removing my old wipers because I had no instructions for that. Once removed, this Bosch blade installed, literally, in seconds. It does come with rather simple directions for installation, and has a snap down protector where the hook is inserted into the arm connection.Anyway, not much to say about a wiper blade if it works and this works fine. It arrived in time to be used on a normal sleet and snowy winter day in the Midwest of the United States. The moisture was wiped away quickly with no streaking. Durability questions are always an issue with any product, and I typically revisit my reviews if there are any abnormal issues there. I expect at least 1 year out of my blades, and usually I get 2 or 3 years.An easy 5 stars for a nice looking piece of equipment that installs easily and (so far) wipes away sleet and snow with no streaking.Note: Since I also acquired theBosch 22A ICON Wiper Bladefor the driver's side of my 2003 Toyota Matrix (21 inches is the exact size recommended for the driver's side of my car) the review for that is pretty much identical to this one.

I have tried a number of other plastic/vinyl or rubber protectants and this by far the best and longest lasting. doesn't leave a greasy feel and really protects and rejuvenates rubber and plastic parts. I use it on my door and window seals on my cars and on the vinyl dash as well as the tires.

This is a great cleaner wax to refurbish a paint job that is needing some help to bring it back to the new glossy look. It will remove the minor scratches and deep dirt/stains you may have on your paint but I use a buffer so don't know how much that plays into it vs hand waxing. I don't use it ever time I wax just when it needs help. I use a non-cleaning wax for my regular wax jobs.

Other's complained about this product sticking, or freezing, or the spring rusting out.  Well the reason is that you shouldn't just put it on dummies.  Purchase some dielectric grease like Permatex 81150, apply that to the threads, the shaft and use a q-tip to get it down onto the spring.  Then occasionally perform some preventative maintenance like when you change the oil, put more grease on it.  When I first got it and took it apart, it was tight and rough in assembly, after applying the grease it's operation is smooth and consistent, and should keep moisture and rust away.  Works perfect with the Rampage JK antennae mount, heavy duty spring and antennae Firestik products.  I'm very pleased with the installation and how clean it sharp it looks.

I read about this tool online and decided to purchase it. It works as described and provides all sorts of data. Synced with my android phone immediately. It reads fault codes and provides realtime data as the vehicle is in operation.I would recommend this scanner to anyone interested in monitoring their vehicle on board computer data plus speeds, e.t.s and all sorts of other functions.
Easy to remove and install bike tireCome with a pair, i think last for everGood to have in your garage

Recently, just this past month, I purchased a new car (Chevrolet Impala). I'm loving everything about it, except for one small detail. The factory windshield wipers that come with it are worthless. Sure a little rain here and there and they work sufficiently, but put them up against our Minnesota winter storms and they are wimpy. You know your blades are worthless when you get dirt, mud, slush all over your windshield and you debate which will make seeing out worse, trying to peer through it or using your wiper blades with the windshield wiper fluid which will probably just smear everything so badly you can see a thing,As soon as I received the Bosch ICON Wiper Blades, I couldn't get them on the car fast enough. With just a few minutes of work, the old factory wiper blades were history and 2 new quality Bosch blades had taken their place. Right away I noticed the difference. Ice doesn't get jammed into these as easily, and snow and slush are no match for these blades. No more issues with slush being streaked across my windshield as the defroster melts everything. It tightly grips the glass and scrapes everything off the windshield in scoops. You can really tell how well your blades work when you put them up against ice and snow, and these are exceeding my expectations. Love them and I can finally see out my windshield in the snow!

They are spot-on sized to actual cartridges.I prefer these over the all-plastic cast dummies as I don't trust that the potential "give" in the all-plastic versions are giving me a true impression of my weapon's action.  I don't want to be surprised about how things are working (or not working) when it's live ammunition.
These covers take seconds to install and eliminate the annoying rubbing on my neck of the seatbelts in my car.  The material is soft and comfortable.
I need this 25 foot extension cord in the garage to reach about 15 feet from the battery tender to my riding mower. The tender is doing its job and the mower should be ready to go in the spring.

Ok- let me preface this review with I am NOT a car decorating person. I ordered these to make my friends and family laugh when they got into Old Red (you know, the Escape that has torn leather seats, 175k+ miles on it, and you're dang lucky she starts in the dead of the Northern winters). Anyway, we hooked them up according to instructions and voila! They light, they flash, they strobe, they change color and laughter from the people in the car ensures. We placed them under the front seats so the glow radiates from below and plugged them in using the cigarette lighter adapter. The adhesive seems to work well on the leather bottomed seats and the cords all plugged into one another. Make sure you have the plugs in the right way so there's a current flowing. i suspect this maybe what happened to other people who couldn't get them to work- you have to make sure the cords are in the correct slots, not just all thrown together. If you are looking for a fun little gag gift or car interest- these might work for you. They are smaller, only 2, 12" strips- so don't think you are getting a huge strip for down the underside of your car. These are just for fun.

I haven't used this product yet but expect it will do a better job than the toothbrush I was using!  I use it with two other effective products available on Amazon, Sonax 230200-755 Wheel Cleaner and Mothers Wheel Brush.  If you have invested in chrome wheels, these products can really make those wheels sparkle.  Brake dust is hard to remove, but these products do the job.

I bought two of these.One of them provides power to my ARB switches and the Dakota Digital air pressure gauge that monitors my ARB system pressure and the other provides power to another Dakota Digital air pressure gauge that monitors my airbag pressure.The switches closely match my ARB switches...which is nice because it just doesn't look nice when the switches on the dashboard don't match.Clearly labeled for ground, power in/out, etc.The light comes on only when you turn the switch on and is not very bright so the light does not present a night-driving distraction problem.Durable.

Easy to install. Fits perfect and allows you to attach your visor too!Great price and I would recommend it.Not a full face one but does the job. The tint is not real dark but does the job.Get yourself one.
I switched out my tachometer and speedometer lights using this LED's. It was fairly simple on my 2000 Camry and this product gave it the finishing touch!

I'm not a fan of quick detailers as a rule, but I need them when I use a claybar.  If you like using quick detailer in between car washings I think you like this as well. This is a good deal.  You get a lot of product for the money.

This one is a little better than one similar product I had previously. It slips around less and blends in well with my black leather seats. If you don't have heated seats in your vehicle this can be great! I wish it included an indoor plug as well, that would have earned at least another star.
Nothing to really complain about here. these light are durable and can easily take a banging. I go into much more detail in my video review.  [...]

It is a battery in a box that will help you jump start vehicles.  Love the plug and leave it charging.  This unit, at least the one I got, has the built in self charger that will not allow over charging of the battery.  I also like the fact it does not have all the gadgets the other unit out there have.  They filled the space in this unit with a bigger battery!!
The receiver tube is manufactured of heavy metal.  It should last for many moons.  I'm going to have it mounted in the front of a flatbed trailer, to skid logs with.

I really can't see giving this less than 4 stars..  No peak hold,  but thats not an issue..  The gauge is like an indiglo color at night which is great.  The numbers are highly visible,  and clear..  Item seems a bit  bigger than the photo leads on.  Otherwise good product.

Let's go over some of the basics of this machine.It provides steam.  Steam can be very helpful in the cleaning/removal of a lot of things.  It comes with a lot of attachments, and some general attachments as well.  We found the floor attachment to basically just heat/dampen a microfiber cloth, not really that great.  However the wallpaper removal one has had good success, as well as a few of the more general tips/extensions.It does take a few minutes to heat up, and then needs to be emptied after use.  It should also be noted that distilled water is recommended to be used, although the manual says that other water can be used (in our case we have a reverse osmosis filter, so we used that).My biggest complaint is storage of all the accessories.  Some fit in the machine, which is great, but a lot don't, and combined with the hose, etc it means you kind of have a mess wherever it is sitting.It's a good cheap way to get steam power for cleaning, and if you have tile/stuck wallpaper/annoying stains, it might help you out.

Works to get the filters off when there's nothing else. Doesn't tend to slip off and makes a good grip on the oil filter. It does dent and deform the filter though, so I only use it to take oil filters off.

Though Amazon stated this cap would not fit my 2013 Ford E-450 chassis (for a Jayco, Class C, Greyhawk, RV), I ordered it anyway as it fits many other years of Ford trucks and looks the same. It is rare for the same vehcle to change a design like that. It, in fact, fits perfectly. Our RV gas filler has no cover (not that that is a deterrant) and 60 gallons is a target for remote theft of gas, or a target for vandalism. This cap fits well. I have not been able to fit the stock cap-retainer onto it yet. I understand these modern vehicles have anti siphon plugs but one can still end up with foreign substances in the exposed fill-tube. This is a good 'ounce of prevention'.Highly recommended.
I bought these and did not realize that they only had 20 LEDs.  I wanted the 42 LED set so I kept these as a back up and ordered the 42 LEDS because these give off very little light.  They are OK!

After using this clay I just assumed clay was a pain to use. But after trying a different brand I know better. This clay falls apart while trying to use it! It also is a very mild clay which isn't a bad thing, but if you want better results, I recommend another brand.
So I recommend this to clean your tires, but it will strip the wax coating off the rims and leave the  rims really dry......

I purchased this product 2 years ago and mounted it on the inside of a cabinet door in my travel trailer.  Since that time it has traveled about 3500 miles there and has worked flawlessly.  Knives stay in place and protected and easy to remove and replace.  10 stars from me.  A perfect fit for my kitchen knives.  Well made and priced just right.
The wheel chocks are perfect when used with the Tri-Lynx Leveler Blocks. They fit together like a puzzle, holding them in place very well.
These K&N oil filters are high quality filters with the benefit of the nut on the bottom.  On some vehicles with limited room around the oil filter, the nut on the bottom is priceless.
Nice soft towels and good size but not impressed with the large border. Fold so as not to get the border in the way of paint surface.
Royal purple has always been the go to fluids in my garage.I will never use another product besides royal purple.

If all you want to do is dust and degrease your interior without marring it up this is the product for you. It will not add shine or gloss to your interior which in my opinion is a good thing on dashboards and instrument clusters. The product works quickly and effectively when used with a medium pile, microfiber cloth.There are reasons Meguiar's has been in business for 112 years, products like this is one of those reasons.

My 2010 Hyundai was hesitating which was very annoying, I put a container in my fuel tank and it took care of the problem which kept on getting worse.  When you wanted to rapidly accelerate you would get a hesitation instead.  For a comprehensive review see the #1 review by Glenn Carpenter.  My gas mileage went up by 2 mpg.My friend's 2013 Hyundai Sonata developed the same problem, the Red Line fixed his problem as well.The active ingredient works very well.  The Amsoil PI that I used before I purchased the Red Line worked very well in my 1994 Toyota curing the hard to start after the truck sat for three months and improved the performance.If you have a problem or want to prevent them Red Line is the best.

The driver's side windshield wiper on our family vehicle was starting to tear apart at the edges so I was happy to try these sample Bosch Clear Advantage Beam Blades.  Last week there were brief but heavy rain showers that allowed me to test new and old style blades side by side.Advantages I've noticed over old style wipers:>Less moving parts than old style metal framed blades.>Spring mechanism is the flexible beam itself rather than old exposed metal springs.>Lower profile for a less obtrusive, more modern appearance, also less likely to get damaged.>Uniform contact points conforms to highly curved windshields for more even wiping/cleaning.>Lighter and appears more durable. Old metal wiper frames tend to fade over time and the rubber blades tear away from the wiper assemblies.>Beam frame designed to create down force on wipers at highway speeds; stable, effortless clearing of windshield.>Lower noise and streaking so far.Overall:A design advancement if wiper design that provides superior performance, safety, and durability over old wiper designs.  Costs about double that of old design wiper blades. Good deal if these new Beam Blades last twice as long as old blades.

It works but like others said, theres nothing easy about getting the old one off. Takes some patience and upper body strength to get it going. Found a similar set locally for a couple bucks less. Quick shipping.

I bought these for a set of Work Meister S1 wheels and so far like them.  The lugs are impressively small and have a snug fitting key adapter.  I have used a number of lugs before and these are probably the smallest I have seen.  The diameter of the the outside of the lug (with the key on) is no bigger than the diameter of the 60 degree lug seat.  This means it should theoretically fit in even the tightest tolerance wheels.These are spline drive lugs, so a standard lug wrench won't get them off.  This likely provides a small degree of security by itself, though for expensive wheels I would recommend a good set of locks.  I picked up theGorilla Automotive 71631NBC Acorn Black Chrome Wheel Locks (12mm x 1.50" Thread Size), Pack of 4.  The finish will likely hold up well over time.  This is due to the nature of the finish itself and the fact that the key fits very precisely and will not slip across the splines.  I find that one of the main reasons regular hex lugs get scratched is ill-fitting wrenches which slip and slide across the surface of the lug.  You will get none of that with these lugs.The key for the lugs has a section for a 3/4" wrench and one for a 13/16" wrench.  I would suggest using the 13/16" since it is closer to the middle of the key, and is a larger diameter.  This will put less stress on the key itself, reducing wear over time.Overall a very well designed set of lugs for tuner wheels.

It seems to be an unwritten law that whenever I am running late, the ice on my windshield will not melt. I have to hop out of the car with a flimsy Dollar Store ice scraper that is only marginally effective, leaving me later, wetter and grumpier than usual.  These mitts may just be the answer.  Essentially, a thumbless potholder with a ice scraper embedded, they promise to keep your hand warm and dry while removing that annoying ice.  The scraper blace itself is far more substantial than most. It is made of thick plasic, about four and a half inches wide. The side has a serrated edge.  The colors are strong an vivid. The red is gorgeous and the black is rich. They are water resistant and have an elasticized wristwith a cuff that is about four inches. The cozy,grey fleece lining is sure to keep hands warm and toasty.They are one size fits all and are ambidextorous.  Lefties and righties, large and small hands will all be able to use these. Although I have not yet had to uutlize them, they seem to be an ideal solution to one of winter's woes and a thoughtful gift for those who have to brave inclement weather.UPDATE 11/28/12-Used this mitt to to clear an ice and snow laden windshield.  It was excellent, cleaning the ice off efficiently and effectively.  The mitt is waterproof and my hand was warm and dry.

K&N; oil filters aren't THE BEST but they rate up there and are great for the cost. Used this as a replacement to the OEM Yamaha filter that was on the bike after the initial break-in period. The 48" hi-Lift hangs over the soft top roof by 3.5" (with the top clamp down or off). I may cut my 48" jack down to 44".  It has tons of leverage against the gate bolts if it snags a good sized limb. Having the extra weight on the gate isn't ideal, but at least it's over the hinges. The manual says only to put 50lbs on the back including the spares weight. The rubicon tire is 75lbs (guess they are not great at math) so really adding any weight isn't great.The base of my cast steel doesn't slide under a lip it was made to slide under. It still will work. I'm going to try to pry it up a 1/16" to make it work better. Maybe it would fit with the cheaper black model base better.NEEDS BOLTS AND ANOTHER SPACEROn the 2012+ there is an extra three 1/2" spacers included to clear the larger hard top window. It's on the last page of the instructions included. It hasn't been added to the online PDF instructions yet. Take a look at that last page before installing. They forgot to add 2 bolts and a spacer to properly take care of the issue. At very least it is missing one 8mm x 70mm metric hex cap bolt. It should say 8.8 or 10.9 on the end. 2 of those bolts is better with a 3/8" x 1" nylon spacer. I found the hardware at menards. Home Depot doesn't carry it.The finish is a wrinkle powdercoat. It looks alright, but will likely hold dirt.The instructions pictures are easier made out off the web. They are on the RR website.After installed it is pretty stout.If you have a 4dr just stick your 48" jack under the rear seat. It's a better option. There are also some good roll bar mounts.INSTALL NOTES AND TIPSI had to remove my rubicon tire before installing. I tried with it on, but the top left bolt was an issue.TRIMTo remove the gate trim pull/push toward the handle side. Then pull back on that side. Then after that angled retainer pops out just give a good tug straight out to get the other side. Label the bottom and top on the inside trim. The top is slightly deeper. It will be very noticeable if they are swapped (1/8" gap on the top. Bottom will look nice).  The instructions template was not printed to scale in the directions. I printed out another true to size template off the RR site. There was an 1/8" difference. It turns out the supplied template was a better fit for me. Line it up with the bolts before drilling. I drilled the hole with a 3/4" wood bit (1/2' will not work for sure).  That will give you some wiggle room. You can also use a hole saw. It will get covered by the plate so no reason to cut it too close. There are a couple places were duck taping the washers to the mounting plates can come in handy if using the factory trim.. It will show if you look directly down at it, but will not be noticeable. If you extend it off the edge maybe you could pull it out after the install.BOLTSThe bolt sizes are mostly 13mm and a couple 15mm at the end. You will want touch-up paint after removing the factory bolts. You can take both the bottom off at the same time with the gate closed. Same thing with the top, just don't take all the bolts out at once. Leave 2 in.  If your installing with the factory trim you'll need to tape the washers before installing the trim. With no tire carrier you will install the big mount also with the right side bolt.On step 2 It's really confusing they say if you have a RR tire carrier do this. Well here is what your going to end up doing with just the factory set-up. Your going to install all the washers and spacers on the bottom right. On the bottom left you will also add the main mount before bolting it on. 2012's that are using the white spacers can bolt both sides with the included bolts and skip adding the main mount part. A better method IMO is to use a longer 70mm bolt and also put a store bought 3/8" spacer (between the main mount and the mounting plate) in on that step.2012+ hardtop owners will add a spacer to the top right bolt. If you use the supplied bolt you will be lucky to get 2 threads screwed in. It really needs a 70mm length bolt.Hope that helps someone. The install took way longer than I expected. Mostly hunting down the bolts. Overall I don't love it on the back. I like it there just a bit better than adding it to the hood because of the jacks weight.

Those who go on long road trips in particular know all too well the difficulty of cleaning your windshield due to bugs and road grime.  Regular water in your reservoir never does the trick but is quite cheap and easy to refill so many use this by default.  Some go as far to buy chugs of windshield wiper fluid at discount stores and this works better but still not that great.  None of these solutions ever worked so what I would do in areas with a lot of bugs was bring along paper towels and windshield cleaner, pull over to the side of the road every so often, and manually clean.  Obviously this wasted a lot of time as I had to find a safe place to pull over, and wasted gas for needless deceleration/acceleration back to speed.Fear not, this product actually does what it needs to do - it clears off your windshield by using a unique formula that attacks bugs and grime so you don't need to apply a lot of wiper fluid to get the window clean.  Yes, I am a believer now.  No longer do I need to bring along my paper towels with cleaner to manually do the windshield.Some hints - use a gallon chug of bottled water to do the mixing.  I would ensure you use bottled water rather than tap because tap water has high mineral contents that can end up clogging your windshield fluid nozzles over time.

I actually have the wash pads and they are not really effective because they hold so much water that they become heavy and cumbersome to use --especially on the side and lower parts of your vehicle.Also, they take forever to dry. One time I accidentally put them away in a container when I thought they were dry but the inside was still moist. The next day, they smelled like mold.You could toss these in the dryer but it would take forever to dry. When you leave them out to dry, they take a few days to completely dry before you can put them back in storage.As far as washing ability, I wasn't impressed. They don't lather up properly and I feel like every time I go over the paint, I am moving water around and not enough soap.My favorite car washing sponge is the Zymol sponge. You can get it for like 8 bucks on eBay. It is made from a higher quality sponge material, it is the perfect size, and it just makes car washing so much easier.  Microfiber is good for a lot of things but I think a good quality sponge is best for washing.  I actually like the sponge better than a sheepskin mitt (Griot's used to sell a superior sheepskin mitt which I have and still use.)I will admit that these micro fiber mitt's/pads look really cool and they feel great when they are dry but once you drop them in the water, they become so heavy that you can't efficiently use them. You might feel otherwise but I have a feeling if you use these, you will encounter the same problems I had.  IMO a good quality washing sponge/cloth should be lightweight when loaded with water and soap so that when you are washing your vehicle, you are able to produce lather.  This wash mitt/pad becomes so heavy when loaded with water that it is not able to effectively do that.I don't recommend this product to wash your car.

5 starts if it were not for them being a bit light on durability.they fit my hand like a golve, go fiture... but the velcro strap is a real weak point.The hook side of the velcro is a ridgid adequate, but the loop side is weak.Not only the loops themselves, i can see them wearing out after a long while, but the entire patch...The threading that holds the loop part gets torn up from the hooks... the glove area around the strap gets torn up by the hooks, the delicate yet fashionable mesh part REALLY gets torn up by the hooks...i took some ice hockey skate protector liquid and just slopped it all around the area for some protection, but still those hooks are tearing up everything they touch... and i am very careful with their use.otherwise 5 starts i love the feel fit and look of these...I almost reduced to 3 stars because of this, its that bad.And if you dont do something to take care of it, they may only last you a seasongood warm weather glove though

Summary: Ingenious cleaning product for anywhere dust gets into nooks and crannies.  A decent add to your detailing tool kit, but with definite limitationsUpon opening the container I was greeted by a bright orange lump of goo.  I was expecting something more like silly putty, this is exactly like a thicker version of "slime" with an orange color and slight citrus / chemical smell.I immediately started to clean the center console of my car.  There's dust, crumbs, spilled coffee, etc here and all sorts of nooks and crannies.  I was immediately disappointed by what it didn't pick up and it did nothing to the drops of dried coffee.  I was thinking that I'd much rather have a damp microfiber washcloth.After a few more days and lots of experimentation on lots of other things I have a higher opinion.  After watching the video I realized they were pressing the goo and holding it for a few seconds.  This really helps SPLAT pick up more stuff, though it's still so-so on larger crumbs and debris (I'm talking about stuff the size of a fingernail clipping.)There are definitely situations that SPLAT works is better - they all involve dust instead of crumbs, and very intricate detail.  For example, on my office seat there are narrow creases in the fabric that trap dust.  This stuff is a champ for pulling it out.  I immediately used it on my nylon briefcase and TV remotes and cordless phones.  It also did a nice job removing the dust on my keyboard.On the other hand it's not so good on cleaning screens and chrome.  It leaves a filmy residue that you have to wipe off.  Also, the consistency has changed just in a couple of days - there's condensation on the lid of the container which suggests that what I am seeing is drying out during use.  I added a few drops of water to the container and it re-hydrated so the consistency is back to original.  At the same time, I noticed that the slime re-hydrated some bread crumbs from the console.  Yuck.  I picked them out - I hope this has some antibacterial properties or I could see this getting moldy before too long.  Finally, seven bucks for 3 ounces seems pricey. I'd give it 4 stars if it was a couple of bucks cheaper.TIP - knead the putty as you use it, otherwise the dust anc crumbs you just picked up will probably end up somewhere else in the interior.There are recipes on the web for making slime.  It's just borax, water, and white glue.  Cut the water and add a few drops of citrus cleaner and you might have a reasonable substitute!>>PlusGreat for dust in hard to reach crevices.Great for getting dust, etc out of fabrics.>>MinusDoes not pick up crumbsLeaves filmy residue -Seems quite pricey for the amount they provideIf you have questions, comments, or if you found this review helpful, please let me know!

I've been using beam blades for some time now, but just for kicks I bought a really cheap traditional blade to see if the performance was really any different.  Initially, all blades seem great - they wipe well and all perform about the same.  Beams are definitely nice in the winter time and that was reinforced by my recent test with the traditional style.  On highways, the beam stick to the windshield better and chatter less.I've tried many different types of beams from Bosch, Valeo and others.  The ACDelco's rate right up there with them, and honestly even among the "premium" vs. standard beam blades, I have never seen much difference in performance even when the price is substantially different.This blade in particular is very easy to install on my 98 Camry.  Over time it's just like others where it'll leave small streaks, but generally won't miss a large swath.  Also like all beam blades I've tried, their aerodynamics cause a bit of a low pressure zone right behind the blade, causing some water to follow the blade from the edge of the windshield back into your view.  This is the most annoying aspect of them to me, and these blades have that effect just like all the others I've tried.In summary, I think this blade performs as well as any other brand of beam blade, so in the future, price would be the deciding factor for me.

Carnauba Wax comes from the fronds of a variety of Palm tree that only grows in Brazil. The wax is very durable and one reference said it is harder than concrete. It protects the palm leaves from the constant intense rays of the sun in the tropics. So it is ideal for protecting your car's paint. There are other products that last longer, but nothing matches the rich and deep warm  gloss that can be achieved using Carnuba wax. It should be applied, ideally, to paint that is not only washed, but depending on the condition of the paint, polished and or clayed to assure it will cover paint that is not  opaque due to oxidation. Only then can it achieve it's complete potential. Apply it with a sponge applicator in a circular motion using it sparingly to one section at a time, allow it to dry to a light haze and remove it with a quality microfiber cloth. Then buff it by hand or orbital buffer. Carnauba wax varies in price by manufacturer and can be very expensive. Previously, my favorite product for the most bang for the buck is called P21s Concours Carnuba Wax. The results if used patiently are spectacular and it costs about five dollars an ounce. My ultimate choice is Pinnacle Sovereign Paste Carnuba, but it is a staggering twelve dollars an ounce or almost $100 for an 8 oz. tin.  This Griot's product costs about $3 an ounce which makes it a screaming bargain by comparison. I found it easy to apply and the gloss is very good. My only question is how long the application lasts. No wax lasts forever and if the results last 5 or 6 months as the two products I mentioned will, that is outstanding. I read some comments of people who said this product did not have that longevity, though I will need to update this later to see what results I observe. Considering how much work and how time consuming it is to detail your car, I think paying double or more for a product that lasts longer is actually cost effective. My results so far are encouraging with this product; easy to use, good shine achieved, very reasonable price comparatively. If it has longevity, this will prove to be a real bargain.
